New Records: Heinrich Klaasen broke the record for the fastest half-century in a T20 World Cup final
Key Match Events: India recovered from 34-3 to finish with an ultimately unassailable 176
Heinrich Klaasen's huge hitting turned the tide in South Africa's favour
Suryakumar Yadav took one of the great catches in World Cup history at long-off to stun South Africa
India closed out the match five balls later as South Africa's wait for a World Cup win continued
Pre-Game Insights: There were no pre-game insights mentioned in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma's side showed their class after recovering from an inauspicious start
India won the T20 World Cup for a second time after a pulsating seven-run victory over South Africa
Rohit Sharma's side showed their class after recovering from an inauspicious start at 34-3 to finish with an ultimately unassailable 176
Miscellaneous Highlights: India won the T20 World Cup for a second time
Heinrich Klaasen's record-breaking half-century was not enough for South Africa to win the match
The bowling of Hardik Pandya, Arshdeep Singh, and Jasprit Bumrah proved crucial to India's win
